title: Enzo Maresca - Wikipedia
snippet: Enzo Maresca (born 10 February 1980) is an Italian professional football manager and former player. He is the head coach of Premier League club Chelsea. After starting out at West Bromwich Albion in 1998, he went on to play for several clubs in his country, including Juventus, who loaned him ...

title: Enzo Maresca Manager Profile, Record & Stats | Premier League
snippet: Enzo Maresca was appointed Chelsea head coach on 3 June 2024, replacing Mauricio Pochettino.

title: Enzo Maresca - Manager profile | Transfermarkt
snippet: This is the profile site of the manager Enzo Maresca. The site lists all clubs he coached and all clubs he played for.

title: List of Chelsea F.C. managers - Wikipedia
snippet: The first manager of Chelsea Football Club was John Robertson, appointed player-manager in 1905. The current head coach is Enzo Maresca. Chelsea have had 32 permanent managers/head coaches (of whom four also served as player-manager), six interim ...

title: Chelsea’s Enzo Maresca high on Manchester City’s list in event of Pep Guardiola exit - The Athletic
snippet: Maresca is well known to the 10-time English champions from two spells either side of a stint as head coach of Italian club Parma. He led City’s Under-21s for the 2020-21 season and returned as a first-team assistant in the summer of 2022. The Italian’s Chelsea contract runs through to 2029, with an option to extend by 12 months, although uncertainty has arisen in recent days after he called the build-up to Saturday’s home victory over Everton “the worst 48 hours since I joined the club, because many people didn’t support us”.
